description.value: A reply to a proposal for medication contraindication is a response from one healthcare provider to another to accept or reject the proposal for medication contraindication of certain medicines that may not be used, or only used under certain conditions.

purpose.value: This Communication resource represents the ReplyProposalContraIndication building block for implementations following the information standard [CiO](https://informatiestandaarden.nictiz.nl/wiki/Landingspagina_Contra-indicaties_en_Overgevoeligheden). This profile does not rely on any Dutch zib ('Zorginformatiebouwsteen', i.e. Health and Care Information Model). Instead, it comprises a variety of data elements. Therefore it has no dependency on a corresponding nl-core profile and mappings to zib concepts are not defined. Instead mappings to the CiO data set have been added.

copyright.value: Copyright and related rights waived via CC0, https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. This does not apply to information from third parties, for example a medical terminology system. The implementer alone is responsible for identifying and obtaining any necessary licenses or authorizations to utilize third party IP in connection with the specification or otherwise.

definition.value: Globally unique number that identifies the instantiation of the information model. The number is composed of an identification of the issuer organization and a unique number assigned by this organization.
Relation to the proposal contraindication that caused the reply.
Date and time when the information was recorded in the patient's record.
The person who is responsible for entering the information in the patient's record.

comment.value:
Each occurrence of the zib HealthProfessional is normally represented by _two_ FHIR resources: a PractitionerRole resource (instance of [nl-core-HealthProfessional-PractitionerRole](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/nl-core-HealthProfessional-PractitionerRole)) and a Practitioner resource (instance of [nl-core-HealthProfessional-Practitioner](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/nl-core-HealthProfessional-Practitioner)). The Practitioner resource is referenced from the PractitionerRole instance. For this reason, sending systems should fill the reference to the PractitionerRole instance here, and not the Practitioner resource. Receiving systems can then retrieve the reference to the Practitioner resource from that PractitionerRole instance.
In rare circumstances, there is only a Practitioner instance, in which case it is that instance which will be referenced here. However, since this should be the exception, the nl-core-HealthProfessional-Practitioner profile is not explicitly mentioned as a target profile.

definition.value: A response to a proposal for registering, retracting, or modifying a medication contraindication. The proposed medication contraindication is either accepted or rejected.

description.value: Detail codes identifying specific communication issues.

definition.value: Textual explanation of the ResponseProposalContraIndication. This free text field can be used to provide the reason for rejecting the proposed medication contraindication.
